info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 3:11PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pike and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 310 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Daisy, or 17 miles south of Mount Ida, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glenwood... Norman... Fancyhill... Salem in Pike County... Hopper... Welsh... Lodi... Caddo Gap... Hurricane Grove... Silver... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
